org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.base.plugins
Class BasicRequestTrackerPlugin

java.lang.Object
  org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.base.DmpServletPlugin
      org.dmd.dmp.server.servlet.base.plugins.BasicRequestTrackerPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
RequestTrackerIF
public class BasicRequestTrackerPlugin
extends DmpServletPlugin
implements RequestTrackerIF

The RequestTrackerPlugin implements the RequestTrackerIF interface and provides a standard mechanism of handling both synchronous and asynchronous Dark Matter Protocol Requests.

Constructor Summary
BasicRequestTrackerPlugin()
          Constructs a new RequestTrackerPlugin.

Method Detail

bindDefaultRequestHandler

public void bindDefaultRequestHandler(DmpRequestProcessorIF requestHandler)
This method allows you to bind a fall back request handler that will be called in the case that no handler has been bound for a particular class of request.

Specified by:
bindDefaultRequestHandler in interface RequestTrackerIF
Parameters:
requestHandler - the handler to call when a Request doesn't have a bound handler

bindRequestProcessor

public void bindRequestProcessor(java.lang.Class<? extends Request> clazz,
                                 DmpRequestProcessorIF requestProcessor)
This method binds a request processor to a particular class that's derived from the the DMP Request class. Generally speaking, the plugin that implements the CacheIF will register handlers for the Get, Set, Create and Delete requests; these are the standard CRUD operations. However, since the Dark Matter Protocol is extensible, you may have to register other handlers for new types of requests.

Specified by:
bindRequestProcessor in interface RequestTrackerIF
Parameters:
clazz - The class of Request handled by the processor.
requestProcessor - The request processor.

processRequest

public int processRequest(Request req,
                          DmpResponseHandlerIF responseHandler)
This method allows you to submit a request and receive asynchronous responses via the response handler. In this case the default timeout of 2 seconds is applied to the request.

Specified by:
processRequest in interface RequestTrackerIF
Parameters:
req - The request.
responseHandler - Where to send the responses.
Returns:
the integer ID of this processing operation.

processSynchronousRequest

public Response processSynchronousRequest(Request req,
                                          DmpResponseHandlerIF asyncResponseHandler,
                                          int timeoutSeconds)
This method allows for synchronous processing of a request; this is generally used when service DMP requests that arrive via GWT RPC. Most operations will have a single response, but, in cases where asynchronous responses can occur e.g. when a GetRequest has a blockingFactor specified or for ActionRequests, the subsequent responses will be relayed via the event channel for the client.

Specified by:
processSynchronousRequest in interface RequestTrackerIF
Parameters:
req - The request.
asyncResponseHandler - The handler that will handle any responses beyond the first one.
timeoutSeconds - The timeout. This should be less than the standard HTTP session timeout.
Returns:
The initial response. If there are any others, they will be sent to the response handler.

processRequest

public int processRequest(Request req,
                          DmpResponseHandlerIF responseHandler,
                          int timeoutSeconds)
This method allows you to submit a request with a specified timeout value.

Specified by:
processRequest in interface RequestTrackerIF
Parameters:
req - The request.
responseHandler - Where to send the response.
timeoutSeconds - The time out delay.

processResponse

public void processResponse(Response resp)
When a request handler has a response available, it sends it back to the RequestTracker via this method.

Specified by:
processResponse in interface RequestTrackerIF
Parameters:
resp - A response for an outstanding request.
